channel.title: JFrog Modernization Workshops on JFrog Workshop
channel.description: Recent content in JFrog Modernization Workshops on JFrog Workshop

item.title: Create a JFrog account
item.description: If you already have a JFrog account, you can skip this page. If you don’t already have an AWS account with Administrator access: create one now Once you have an AWS account, ensure you are following the remaining workshop steps as an IAM user with administrator access to the AWS account: Create a new IAM user to use for the workshop Enter the user details: Attach the AdministratorAccess IAM Policy: Click to create the new user: Take note of the login URL and save:

item.title: Create an AWS account
item.description: Your account must have the ability to create new IAM roles and scope other IAM permissions. If you already have an AWS account, and have IAM Administrator access, you can skip this page. If you don’t already have an AWS account with Administrator access: create one now Once you have an AWS account, ensure you are following the remaining workshop steps as an IAM user with administrator access to the AWS account: Create a new IAM user to use for the workshop

item.title: Artifactory
item.description: Now we are going to populate the JFrog Platform with the tutorial. Please fork the following JFrog Tutorial GitHub project. Login into Artifactory. Go into Pipelines -> Integrations. Click “Add an Integration”. Select “Artifactory” as the integration type and name it: Artifactory. Provide your Artifactory URL and your Credentials. Add another Pipelines integration: Integration type: GitHub, name: GitHub. Provide your GitHub personal access token (follow these instructions for the creation of the token).
